magpie.utility.interfaces

Class Citation

  • java.lang.Object
    • magpie.utility.interfaces.Citation

  • public class Citation
extends java.lang.Object
    Class used by Citable to define a resource being cited.

    • Field Detail

      • Component

        public final java.lang.Class Component
        Component this citation is associated with

      • Authors

        public final java.lang.String[] Authors
        Author(s) associated with this citation

      • Title

        public final java.lang.String Title
        Title of resource being cited. Examples: Title of paper, name of software package.

      • Type

        public final java.lang.String Type
        Type of resource being cited. Examples: "Article", "Webpage", "Book", "Thesis"

      • Location

        public final java.net.URL Location
        URL of resource being cited. If not available, list None

      • Notes

        public final java.lang.String Notes
        Anything else that a user should know about this resource.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Citation

        public Citation(java.lang.Class component,
        java.lang.String type,
        java.lang.String[] authors,
        java.lang.String title,
        java.lang.String url,
        java.lang.String notes)
        Create a new citation object. Optional arguments can be null. This should give enough information for the person to find the resource but need not include enough information for a complete citation.
        Parameters:
        component - Component that this citation is associated with
        authors - Optional: List of authors. [0] should be the primary author. Preferred format: <first initial>. <family name>. Recommended to use "et al." for author lists longer than 3.
        title - Title of resource
        type - Type of resource being cited (e.g., "Article", "Webpage", "Book").
        url - Optional: URL of resource
        notes - Optional: Anything else someone who cites this should know
